Before JIRA 5.2.6, if you clone an issue, the links appeared in the wrong way, as stated in the following bug:

The best solution for this would be a fix during the upgrade, so the old cloned issues will show the right links.

h3. Workaround: 
-- [How to Fix Links in Wrong Direction After Cloning an Issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Fix+Links+in+Wrong+Direction+After+Cloning+an+Issue]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32294].
  {panel}

*Reproduction Steps*
Load / Refresh the view issue page for an issue on latest JIRA Master OnDemand

*What Happens*
* The following JS error is returned:
{code}TypeError: n.google.maps.Load is not a function{code} 
* As a result, clicking on value for Location custom field doesn't show Google map

*Environment to reproduce problem*
* JIRA OnDemand version: ondemand-fireball-jira-master-1160
* Browser and OS environments:
|| Browser || OS ||
| Firefox (19.0.2) | Mac OS X (10.7.5) |
| Safari 6.0.2 (7536.26.17) | Mac OS X (10.7.5) |
| Chrome 25.0.1364.172 | Mac OS X (10.7.5) |
| IE 8 (8.0.7601.17514) | Windows 7 - Service Pack 1 |
| IE 9 (9.0.8112.16421) | Windows 7 Professional - Service Pack 1 |
| IE 10 | Windows 8 (version 6.2, build 9200) |

As Google Maps is being loaded on JIRA.Events.NEW_CONTENT_ADDED (which is now being fired multiple times per page), Google Maps is potentially being loaded twice by JIRA Suite Utilities, resulting in the JS error occurring and the inability to view Google maps of location fields.

[~scinos], a JIRA developer, has listed the following for JIRA Suite Utilities to investigate in (as potential methods to rectify the issue). Please do not hesitate to mention or contact him if you have any questions regarding these:
# use a namespaced JSONP callback for loading Google Maps. Right now "onGMapsLoad" is being used and could conflict with other plugins
# check the "reason" parameter when listeing to JIRA.Events.NEW_CONTENT_ADDED. On KickAss we fire that event a few times per page and probably not all of them should trigger a Google Maps load
# Check that JIRA Suite Utilities is not trying to load google maps again if they have loaded it once but they are still waiting for the network
# update the code to use google.loader() instead loading gmaps directly
fields.summary: JIRA Suite Utilities causing Google Maps to load again if another plugin has already loaded it
Scheduling could be a lot easier

  {panel}

h3. Summary

When using Firefox, attempting to attach a file using the issue collector can fail with an error about a missing token. This occurs if the third-party cookies functionality is not enabled.

h3. Environment

Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Disable third-party cookie support in Firefox.
# Attempt to attach a file using the JIRA Issue Collector plugin.

h3. Expected Results

The file uploads successfully.

h3. Actual Results

The below error is presented to the user in the browser:

{noformat}
Cannot attach file [FILENAME].png: JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

# Go to Preferences section of FireFox.
# Under the Privacy tab, check if you have chosen to "Use custom settings for History".
# If so, make sure that "Accept third-party cookies" has been checked.

h3. Notes

In fact if you're not attaching a file, the issue does still get submitted, so there's does not appear to be a requirement to write cookies. 

Another potential workaround would be that the JIRA Issue collector plugin could also issue an error message to the user to change any settings that could affect writing cookies, such as allowing third-party cookies.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Collector fails to attach file if third-party cookies are not enabled in Firefox

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32276].
  {panel}

Ensure that the JIRA export file provided by the customer is UTF-8. The encoding is specified in the XML document so it should be fairly straightforward to detect this.

Non-UTF-8 encodings aren't supported so we should stop them from getting into the system. They can't be easily converted.

h3. Notes

If this isn't done the XML backup can fail with errors as described below:

* [Unable to Restore XML Backup due to Invalid Byte Sequence for Encoding "UTF8": 0x00|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=389285646]
* [SQL Exception while Updating Issues or Importing Data in JIRA with MySQL Due to Encoding|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/SQL+Exception+while+updating+issues+or+importing+data+in+JIRA+applications+with+MySQL+due+to+encoding]

h3. Workaround
[Removing invalid characters from XML backups|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Removing+invalid+characters+from+XML+backups]
fields.summary: When importing XML backups they should be converted into UTF-8 and have any invalid characters stripped

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32255].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

As we know the activity stream in user profile are not possible to be customizable to retrieve the information needed, it is an known case that the activity stream in user profile would possibly 
time out after 10 seconds(the default timeout) especially when the JIRA instance integrated with many other application(eg. Confluence).

h3. Suggested Solution

As there's no plan for activity stream being configurable in other parts of JIRA as specified [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-28739?focusedCommentId=447818&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-447818],  add an option in General Configuration for administrator to configure the default timeout for activity stream to be user specified, so it could be longer than 10 seconds.
fields.summary: Configuration for default timeout in activity stream

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32221].
  {panel}

As HTMLSafe is being turned on as default in JIRA 6.0, fixes are required for Cloud Connectors to be HTMLSafe Compatable.

For remote object link custom fields (that use remotefield-view.vm velocity template), if you configure the custom field to have a header or body in html, it becomes double-escaped:

!salesforce.png!

This is reproducible for the following custom fields (which use remotefield-view.vm):
* Remote Object ID Custom Field
* Single Remote Object Link Custom Field
* Multiple Remote Object Link Custom Field

We were unable to confirm the HTMLSafe-ness of the Remote Attachments issue tab as following instructions on [Customware provided documentation|http://wiki.customware.net/repository/display/SFJIRA/Pulling+attachments+from+Salesforce+to+JIRA] did not cause it to show. Please ensure that this is HTMLSafe.

Please ensure you follow the [Velocity Templates guide here|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Velocity+Templates] to ensure that all returned values from velocity templates are not double escaped and are HTMLSafe compatable.

Plugin versions:
* Core connector plugin - 1.2.3
* JIRA connector plugin - 1.2.3
* Connector for Salesforce and JIRA - 5.2.2.1
* Connector for Zendesk and JIRA - 2.2.3
* Connector for Get Satisfaction and JIRA - 2.2.1
* Connector for uTest and JIRA - 1.2.1
fields.summary: Fixes required for HTMLSafe Compatability - Cloud Connectors

  {panel}

Hi,

Currently the Issue Collector will publish an error on the collector similar to:
"Required fields not present in collector '<collector name>' invoked from _John Doe_"

This error is due to a mandatory field, as set in https://<instance>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<project-key>/fields, not being present in the collector.

Improvements to this process would be:
* Updating the issue collector error to specify the name of the required field that is missing
* Prompt or prevent user removing mandatory field when configuring an Issue Collector

Cheers,
Paul
fields.summary: Issue Collector improve 'Required Field' Error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the saved filter's name has an hyphen on its name, the search will not work correctly in the *View all filters* page.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 * Perform an advanced search, save it as a name separated by hyphen (e.g. *wa - moon*);
 * Navigate to Jira home -> *Issues and filters* -> *View all filters*;
 ** Searching for *was* will return the filter:
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-16 at 11.42.09.png|thumbnail!
 ** Searching for *wa -* will not retrieve the filter:
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-16 at 11.42.19.png|thumbnail!
 ** Searching by the full name will not retrieve it either:
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-16 at 11.42.38.png|thumbnail!
 ** Searching by *moon* will retrieve the filter:
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-16 at 13.37.20.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected results

The filter should be retrieved in all of those search scenarios.
h3. Actual results

The scenarios where the hyphen is included in the search do not work.
h3. Workaround

Search by the first part of the name, or by the last one.

 
h3. Notes

+Impact on APIs+

The same behaviour can be observed when using the {{/rest/api/3/filter/search}} API endpoint.

For example, if there are 2 filters in an instance called "{{Support Issues - ALL"}} and "{{Support Issues"}}, the following happens:
 * +Not expected+: when searching for "{{Support Issues - ALL}}" via the API ("{{/rest/api/3/filter/search?filterName=Support%20Issues%20-%20ALL}}"), the results only contains "{{Support Issues" }}and not {{"}}{{Support Issues - ALL}}{{" }}while only {{"}}{{Support Issues - ALL}}{{"}} should be returned{{}}
 * +Expected+: when searching for "{{Support Issues}}" via the API ("{{/rest/api/3/filter/search?filterName=Support%20Issues}}"), both filters "{{Support Issues" }}and {{"}}{{Support Issues - ALL}}{{"}} are returned as expected because the filterName attribute does a partial match{{}}
fields.summary: Saved Filters not showing up in Filter Search (View all filters) due to hyphen in the filter's name

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32211].
  {panel}

As a JIRA admin, It will be great to have the option to choose a user, who has 'Modify Reporter' permission, to prevent/allow issue creation for user who does not have the 'create issue' permission.

Currently in JIRA, if a user has the _'Modify Reporter'_ permission and _'Create Issue'_ permission, he will be able to create an issue and set the 'Reporter' to any other users in JIRA, even if the reporter does not have the 'create issue' permission.

This made for some specific usage (Ie. we only allow some users to track on issue but not creating any issues.)

However, in some situation, we do not want to allow any users as a 'Reporter' if he does not have the 'create issue' permission. Since it is currently not possible to check who is the original user who create this issue, it can cause confusion as to who is the original creator.
 
It's just more than great if there is an option that can allow users to choose on this behavior.
fields.summary: options to choose user who has 'Modify Reporter' permission can/can't create issue for user who does not have the 'create issue' permission

E.g. the EULA agreement text on the Gliffy JIRA administration page:

!gliffy_jira.png!

As we do not have test licenses for each different kind of Gliffy JIRA license (e.g. free licenses, paid licenses), please ensure that *all* velocity templates in Gliffy for JIRA 3.8-OD1 is HTMLSafe compatable. Please follow the [Velocity Templates guide here|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Velocity+Templates] to ensure that values are not double escaped.
fields.summary: Fixes required for HTMLSafe compatability - Gliffy for JIRA 3.8-OD1

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32197]. {panel} JIRA Timesheet Reports and Gadgets Plugin 2.3.14 contains values which are double escaped as a result of HTMLSafe being turned on as default. Please follow the [Velocity Templates guide here|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Velocity+Templates] to ensure that values are not double escaped 1) The following displayed values are being double escaped as a result of HTMLSafe being turned on as default on following reports. * Timesheet Report ** Timesheet report date heading ** Additional Fields - Linked Issues and Time Tracking ** Displayed linked issues (when grouping by Linked Issues) ** Logged work comments * Pivot Report ** Additional Fields - Linked Issues and Time Tracking Please see attached images for examples 2) The link URL for configuring the pivot or timesheets report is not being escaped properly when *two or more* query parameters are added to the URL e.g. from pivot-report.vm: {code} #set($configure = "$req.contextPath/secure/ConfigureReport!default.jspa?startDate=$textUtil.urlencode($dpDate.format($startDate))&endDate=$textUtil.urlencode($dpDate.format($endDate))&reportKey=jira-timesheet-plugin:projectpivot") #if ($showIssues) #set ($colspan = 5 + $moreFields.size()) #foreach ($field in $moreFields) #set($configure = "$configure&moreFields=$textUtil.urlencode($field)") #end   #else #end $i18n.getText("report.pivot.startdate"): $outlookDate.format($startDate) $i18n.getText("report.pivot.enddate"): $outlookDate.format($endDate) #if ($projectId) #set($configure = "$configure&projectid=$textUtil.urlencode($projectId)") #end #if ($filterId) #set($configure = "$configure&filterid=$textUtil.urlencode($filterId)") #end {code} If project and filter are specified (for example), the URL is encoded as: {code}https://kyubey.jira-dev.com/secure/ConfigureReport!default.jspa?startDate=13%2FMar%2F13&endDate=19%2FMar%2F13&reportKey=jira-timesheet-plugin:projectpivot&projectid=10204&filterid=10100{code} This results in user not being able to click the link to configure the report: !timesheet_report_invalid_key.png!
fields.summary: Fixes required for HTMLSafe compatability - JIRA Timesheet Reports and Gadgets Plugin 2.3.14

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32196].
  {panel}

Proposed design:

* Comments use the same issue security scheme as issues within the same project.
* There is a new setting in the issue security scheme that allows you to set the default for comments separately from the default for issues.
* Reporter pertains to the issue, not the comment.
* Visibility via groups and roles can be disabled in favour of this more comprehensive mechanism.

This is to address the following significant concerns:

* Ability to restrict comment visibility to a custom field or reporter.  This offers per-user visibility granularity rather than per-system (group) or per-project (role).
* Roles that contain subsets of users could be merged with other roles to ensure visibility to appropriate people.  For example if we have people that are in a Tester role and issues show up on Tester dashboards for testing, then  we would make a security level that has both Tester and Manager.  Right now if they select the Tester role then managers are excluded.  Managers aren't part of the testing workflow so they shouldn't have testing issues showing up on their dashboard for example.
* Ability to set default comment visibility.
* Ability to restrict set of comment visibility overrides.  It doesn't just show up as some arbitrary list of groups that happen to exist in the system.

Comments are the most significant subdivisions of issues and not being able to control visibility properly is a recurring problem for us.
fields.summary: Comment "Viewable by" should also include issue security levels

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32189].
  {panel}

Hi,

when migrating JIRA plugin from 5.2.6 to 6.0-SNAPSHOT, if the plugin key contains SPACE at the end, it cannot be started in UPM.

This is a minor issue, but changed behavior from 5.2.6 to 6.0

Workaround: remove space from the end of the plugin key

fields.summary: JIRA 6.0 changes behaviour in loading plugin modules
Add support for mobile devices to Issue Collector dialog
To the point help page with video tutorials

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32185].
  {panel}

I'm using Jira for test case management. I've created custom fields such as Test Run Count, Test Fail Count and Test Pass Count so that I can report on how many times a certain test was run/failed/passed against a release.

I've added those fields to my default screen so that they can be visualized. However, chances are that thanks to Inline Editing feature of fields, one can mistakenly edit those fields and can ruin my statistics.

Although this can be visualized through Issue History, it'll be cumbersome to revert to older values.

What I'd like to have is restrict editing of this fields to specific users, e.g. admins, team-leaders, etc. I've looked around the Permissions thing to see if I'm able to apply such a configuration but with no luck.
fields.summary: Ability to allow editing of certain fields to specific users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32184].
  {panel}

The JIRA project contains 27753 issues (as of today):
https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20JRA

There are 10 issues with fixVersion "6.0-OD-10"
https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20JRA%20AND%20fixVersion%20%3D%20%226.0-OD-10%22

There are 9414 issues which doesn't have fixVersion "6.0-OD-10"
https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20JRA%20AND%20fixVersion%20!%3D%20%226.0-OD-10%22

Something is wrong - it doesn't add up to 27753! Yes, the error is if fixVersion is null, then that is not displayed as either of the search results above. It should be displayed as part of the fixVersion != "6.0-OD-10".
fields.summary: Incorrect functionality of != in filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32182].
  {panel}

Having a poller that relentlessly pokes at our IMAP service is good for neither service.  IMAP IDLE is not a solution according to the bug I cloned this from.

A better solution would would to configure Jira to listen on an LMTP port for incoming mails; I could then set up a simple MTA on the Jira host which delivers to this LMTP port (eg. postfix) and redirect all mail going to the Jira address to this intermediate MTA.

Currently I'm working on a workaround with a local POP3 server but that solution is far from optimal.

I also found this related request on Atlassian Answers:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/72339/jira-setup-smtp-server-for-incoming-mails
fields.summary: Jira support for LMTP

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32181]. {panel} By default, there are no method to include image icon on the select list options other than editing the template (customization). In order to manually create a select list with icons, html tags are added to the select list options. This work on the issue screen but not the create issue, edit issue and resolve issue screen. Only the text is available, refer to the screenshot below for the details: As an example, the below code is added as an option in the select list: {code} Bug {code} *View when create issue* !listview.png! *View after issue created* !issuesummaryview.png! It would be nice if the html is able to render during the select list on issue creation screen or edit screen so that user can have a nicer presentation on the options available.
fields.summary: Rendering Improvement for Select List in Screens

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32180].
  {panel}

scenario: 
# a bug gets identified by client - they create an issue
# project manager investigates and confirms it is a bug - adds a screen shot
# tech team discuss how to fix via comments
# tech A draws 2 diagrams for options, adds to issue
# tech B takes a screenshot confirming the bug exists in other areas

When someone comes to this issue, it is quite difficult to follow the conversation unless you also check the dates on each of the attachments. ie: some comments refer to the image. It can be hard to understand the attached file without the related comment.

Adding files is a bit misleading as when you attach a file you can also add a comment - but the two don't really connect in the UI (unless you view all activity). Even then it is just the name of the file rather than a thumbnail.

What would be helpful is to show a thumbnail of the image or icon of file next to the comment text. That way it would be much easier to understand the flow of discussion in comments.
fields.summary: Associate attachments with comments in stream - show uploaded files next to comments to help users understand context

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32179].

Hi,

TIA,
-Mihai
fields.summary: Workflow Transition Condition
Allow digits in project keys

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32177].
  {panel}

Hi,

In case you add a new project Confluence Space will be created automatically with default permissions.
Each time I create a project I need to modify confluence space permissions. 
It will be a great improvement if Confluence Space permissions will be configured at JIRA Permission Schemes (since each project is connected with 1 Space).

I.e. I have 4 Permissions Schemes (15 Projects each). When I create a new project I assign a permission scheme to it. But for Confluence Space I need to do it separately (add corresponding 3-4 groups, check ~40 check-boxes). 
Another example:
If I decide to add some group to Permission scheme then I need to go and modify permissions at all Confluence Spaces - which is headache.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Link Confluence Space permissions to Jira Permissions Scheme in a related Project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32176].
  {panel}

it will be useful if you will add ability (like second optional step) to assign project roles when creating new project.
In my opinion it should looks like a table with usernames in first column and project roles in first row.
In addition it will be useful to have a username filter by groups at that page.

My case is: I have 4 project types with the same permission scheme (based on Project roles)
each project in project type almost always have the same people assigned to project role. So I can't use a single list of Default Members for project Roles.
From other side I can use different project roles for each project like Type1Developer, Type1QA, etc but it is not good as well.

Another idea is to have project role schemes (with default members), which can be assigned per project.
fields.summary: Add ability to assign project roles at "Creating new project" stage
Add a workflow validator or post function to disallow resolving with particular versions in the fix version field
View Components Gadget
Ability to view issues by issue type under project browser
